issue.title: intermittent issue in rpc_signer.py (enumeratesigners timeout)
issue.body:
https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5094568045051904?logs=ci#L4419

```
[18:26:32.573] test_framework.authproxy.JSONRPCException: 'enumeratesigners' RPC took longer than 1200.000000 seconds. Consider using larger timeout for calls that take longer to return. (-344)
```

Looking at the full log, the test is just idle and then times out. However, there is no indication why the RPC does not proceed.

events.body:
Same https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4561849141690368?logs=ci#L6059

So I guess this was recently introduced

If it's #32343 i don't understand why. It was changed so that the brute force fd-closing path isn't even *compiled* on Linux.

No idea what could even take so long, unless it's an obscure bug in the C++ library like `fs::directory_iterator` looping forever.

It would be reasonaly useful to if it logged a full backtrace of bitcoind (gdb `thread apply all bt`) in these case of timeouts. 

Though, i'm not sure that's enough to debug this. If this is what we think that it is, this is already happening in the forked process, after all. This similarly makes it difficult to add debug logging.

Edit: i'll make an implementation using bare `readdir` instead of the `fs_iterator`, and open a PR. So we can see if that fixes it.
I've created 50 runs and they all passed: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5325312260571136 So I guess this is related. I'll try to get the gdb bt next.
In the meantime, I place my bet that this is a gcc-11 upstream bug ðŸ¤ž

The bt is:

```
Thread 9 (Thread 0x7f0973400640 (LWP 21341) "b-httpworker.5"):
#0  __GI___libc_read (nbytes=1024, buf=0x7f09733fb7f0, fd=30) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/read.c:26
#1  __GI___libc_read (fd=30, buf=0x7f09733fb7f0, nbytes=1024) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/read.c:24
#2  0x0000564d74731ba3 in subprocess::Popen::execute_process() ()
#3  0x0000564d74732b44 in subprocess::Popen::Popen<subprocess::input, subprocess::output, subprocess::error, subprocess::close_fds>(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, subprocess::input&&, subprocess::output&&, subprocess::error&&, subprocess::close_fds&&) ()
#4  0x0000564d747299f5 in RunCommandParseJSON(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&) ()
#5  0x0000564d7457642c in ExternalSigner::Enumerate(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, std::__debug::vector<ExternalSigner, std::allocator<ExternalSigner> >&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >) ()
#6  0x0000564d73e7f8e5 in enumeratesigners()::{lambda(RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&)#1}::operator()(RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&) const [clone .constprop.0] ()
#7  0x0000564d73e815d2 in std::_Function_handler<UniValue (RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&), enumeratesigners()::{lambda(RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&)#1}>::_M_invoke(std::_Any_data const&, RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&) ()
#8  0x0000564d74630660 in RPCHelpMan::HandleRequest(JSONRPCRequest const&) const ()
#9  0x0000564d73e6334e in CRPCCommand::CRPCCommand(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >, RPCHelpMan (*)())::{lambda(JSONRPCRequest const&, UniValue&, bool)#1}::operator()(JSONRPCRequest const&, UniValue&, bool) const [clone .isra.0] ()
#10 0x0000564d73f80826 in ExecuteCommands(std::__debug::vector<CRPCCommand const*, std::allocator<CRPCCommand const*> > const&, JSONRPCRequest const&, UniValue&) ()
#11 0x0000564d73f80e4d in CRPCTable::execute(JSONRPCRequest const&) const ()
#12 0x0000564d73f81031 in JSONRPCExec(JSONRPCRequest const&, bool) ()
#13 0x0000564d740fbb02 in HTTPReq_JSONRPC(std::any const&, HTTPRequest*) ()
#14 0x0000564d7411405d in WorkQueue<HTTPClosure>::Run() ()
#15 0x0000564d7410ca38 in HTTPWorkQueueRun(WorkQueue<HTTPClosure>*, int) ()
#16 0x00007f097c4cf253 in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#17 0x00007f097c157ac3 in start_thread (arg=<optimized out>) at ./nptl/pthread_create.c:442
#18 0x00007f097c1e9850 in clone3 () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone3.S:81
```

Whatever the issue is, it may be fixed in gcc-14. At least https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5477938151292928 passed 25 times. (The prior commit with gcc-12 failed at least once: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5645419964792832?logs=ci#L4122). Gcc-13 also failed at least once: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/4577002323181568?logs=ci#L690

```
Thread 33 (Thread 0x7f9d93e006c0 (LWP 18294) "b-httpworker.2"):

That backtrace is exactly what i'd expected. It's the parent process waiting for the forked child there.
